author: jtraglia
content:
Hi all, I just made this PR:
https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/4476

author: raulvk
content: Are CLs doing anything specific for local block builders to find and stay connected to peers on all 128 column topics?

author: barnabasbusa
content:
teku-geth-2 has bad block generator
prysm-besu-1 has 64 column withholding

author: barnabasbusa
content: so if these nodes are missing some blocks its probably due to this

author: manunlp
content: Even with 64 column withholding, `prysm-besu-1` should not miss blocks

author: yperbasis
content: Incorrect too_many_blobs tests

author: manunlp
content:
Would CL teams be interested if Prysm adds a "cgc liar" mode in Prysm?
aka. a Prysm node will advertise cgc=m while in reality it will subscribe/store/custody/serve only data column sidecars corresponding to cgc=n, with n<m.

Could be useful to test if client implementations are resilient to such dishonnest peers.

author: manunlp
content: Or maybe other CL implementations already have such a flag?

author: jimmygchen
content: Yeah there‚Äôs ‚Äú‚Äîadvertise-false-cgc‚Äù in lighthouse , does what you described

author: manunlp
content: Oh nice thanks

author: manunlp
content: Will use it

author: barnabasbusa
content: thtas what prysm has been doing for the past 3 month üòÇ (last month has been good)

author: manunlp
content: really? Where?

author: barnabasbusa
content: well the cgc stuff was just borked

author: barnabasbusa
content: i mean

author: manunlp
content: I was not aware of that. Is there a message somewhere?

author: barnabasbusa

author: manunlp
content: hum even in your example the cgc was ok. Anyway, the important matters is it works now

author: agnxsh
content: cgc borking shouldn't even be a problem if peer filtering is not too aggressive

author: agnxsh
content: also cgc can vary at times, through the epoch, after restart etc

author: agnxsh
content: based on validator custody updation safety checks

author: manunlp
content: a too-high advertised cgc could create issue when syncing.

author: agnxsh
content: ofc

author: agnxsh
content: well that time we use minimal cgc

author: manunlp
content: You request by range/root columns from peers, they don't serve them. The requester has to act accordingly

author: agnxsh
content: if not a supernode by flag

author: agnxsh
content: ideally we do very mild downscoring, if _none_ of the columns match us

author: agnxsh
content: otherwise we send our missing column array

author: agnxsh
content: if the peer has anything they give us, whatever subset that may be

author: agnxsh
content: because peer filtering is a pain, and peers are also useful for blocks

author: agnxsh
content: for a non supernode, while syncing validator duties is off anyway, so i think it's safe to sync with a lower cgc? and then backfill excess and modulate `earliest_available_slot`, likewise

author: manunlp
content: Could be an idea yes

author: manunlp
content: But it kinda break the validator custody promise

author: __flcl
content: Small fixes to make real output fully match eip https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/10079/files
